entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French disner, diner to eat, have a meal, from Vulgar Latin *disjejunare to break one's fast, from Latin dis- + Late Latin jejunare to fast, from Latin jejunus fasting

def.dt: :to take dinner often used with on dine on pasta
:to give a dinner to wined her and dined her
:to eat a meal away from home
:to use as a subject for dining table conversation
